"use client"; import { useState } from "react"; import { motion } from "framer-motion"; import { FiCheckCircle, FiSearch, FiFilter, FiDownload, FiEye } from "react-icons/fi"; import Link from "next/link"; import Image from "next/image"; // Placeholder orders until database is wired const DUMMY_ORDERS = [ { id: "NIL-49201", customer: "Rahul Krishna", date: "Oct 24, 2023", total: 45000, status: "Pending", items: 2 }, { id: "NIL-58212", customer: "Anjali Menon", date: "Oct 23, 2023", total: 32000, status: "Confirmed", items: 1 }, { id: "NIL-19344", customer: "Vinod Kumar", date: "Oct 22, 2023", total: 12000, status: "Delivered", items: 1 }, { id: "NIL-84920", customer: "Priya Das", date: "Oct 21, 2023", total: 55000, status: "Shipped", items: 3 }, { id: "NIL-23849", customer: "Mohammed Ali", date: "Oct 20, 2023", total: 125000, status: "Confirmed", items: 2 }, ]; export default function AdminOrders() { const [orders, setOrders] = useState(DUMMY_ORDERS); const [search, setSearch] = useState(""); const [filter, setFilter] = useState("All"); const filtered = orders.filter( o => o.id.includes(search) || o.customer.toLowerCase().includes(search.toLowerCase()) ).filter(o => filter === "All" || o.status === filter); return (

messages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.
